intro: Tripleurospermum macrocephalum, commonly known as the large-headed ray flover, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and somewhat hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical characteristics make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
